item.title: Dead Letter Exchange in Clojure
item.description: The Problem In one of the project that I’m working on, we have several microservices that talk each other via RabbitMq messages. When the microservice A gets a message from the service B, it creates a new db record; when A gets a message from service C, it will look for an existing record and updates it. It is possible though that the message from C gets to A before the message from B, discarding the update or throwing an exception.

item.title: Async Await
item.description: The problem Our node program has to perform some operation in a precise order. In details, we want to: read a json file compile an Handlebar template with the result data copy all the assets in the output directory produce an html and a pdf from the compiled html The first step is writing some asynchronous function that will return a Promise. Then we will put everything togheter using both async/await and the classic then chaining method
